page.title: 20RIVER YAR (EAST)
page.content: The River Yar runs through the valley at the northern edge of Newchurch and through Alverstone village. The flatlands on either side of the river have an abundance of plant life. A walk along the old{RAILWAY TRACK,} which runs along side the river reveals this plant life. Reedmace (bullrush) one of Britains disappearing plants can be seen in great numbers, common watercress is found everywhere and marsh marigolds can also be seen. The grass is lush and the{MEADOWS}are used for cattle and horses. If walkers are quiet, they will be able to see water voles swimming about and kingfishers darting after insects and fish. {DRAGONFLIES}dart over the water in the summer and{WATER BIRDS} swim happily with their young.
